name: sugarcane production | sugarcane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19686/documentation

This dataset represents the production of sugar cane in Colombia. All the exchanges are calculated per kg of sugar cane (wet mass). The inventory for the cultivation of sugar cane in Colombia is based on field data from the main industrial sugar cane cultivation area in Colombia (Valle geografico del Rio Cauca). ;In Colombia the average crop cycle of sugar cane is 12.6 months and it is cultivated for 6 cycles (ratoon crops) before the plantation is renewed. The average productivity is 111.5 tons of sugar cane per hectare and year. Before harvesting, 70% of the area is burned. The inventory of sugar cane cultivation in Colombia includes the use of mineral and organic fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation, machinery and the field emissions from pre-harvest burning, as well as from the fertilizer and pesticide application.;;The total nutrient application is 161 kg N, 13 kg P2O5 and 34 kg K2O per hectare and year from mineral fertilizers (urea, potassium chloride, DAP, ammonium sulphate, etc.) and organic fertilizers (manure, compost and vinasse).;;The field is irrigated with 1140m3 per hectare and year.;;The applied active ingredients for pest control include glyphosate, [sulfonyl]urea-compound, triazine-compound, atrazine and phenoxy-compound.

From preparing the land and planting sugar cane.

This dataset ends with the harvesting of sugarcane and includes the land preparation and the crop management (fertilizers, pesticides, and machinery).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0114:Growing of sugar cane

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period of the most of the data collected for this dataset.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modeled for Colombia (Valle geografico del Rio Cauca) based on field data representing 32215 ha (15% of the total sugar cane plantation area in Colombia).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of sugar cane with 30 % mechanical harvest and 70 % manual harvest.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Carbon content and gross calorific value are based on ecoinvent database.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Field data. The main sugar cane cultivation area (216768 ha) in Colombia is located in the "Valle geografico del Rio Cauca". Out of the total area under sugar cane cultivation, 7 plantations (32215 ha, 15% of the total area) were randomly selected for the LCI data collection. The average LCI values from the 7 plantations were used (weighted average by size of the plantation).

exchanges.description: Harvested sugar cane stalks from Colombia with a moisture content of 74%. Pre-harvest burning of 70% of the fields.

flow.name: sugarcane
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0114:Growing of sugar cane

exchanges.description: Estimation: During land preparation fertilizers are applied (diesel consumption: 4.2 kg /ha). After every harvest (total 6 cuttings), additional fertilizer is applied to provide optimal growth conditions for the ratoon crop (diesel consumption: 1.5 kg/ha). The values used for the processes are extrapolated from the diesel use of the datasets (fertilizing, by broadcaster: 5.29 kg diesel per ha).

flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

exchanges.description: Calculated value: calculations according to chapter "Emissions of Pesticides to Agricultural Soil" in "01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf" - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation). 40% of the triazine herbicides are based on ametryn and 60% on terbutryn. Since the environmental emission "terbutryn to soil" does not exist, the emission is modeled as 100% ametryn to the soil (both active ingredients are classified as emthylthiotrazine herbicides).

exchanges.description: Calculated value: from carbon balance.

exchanges.description: Estimation: The diesel consumption for sugar cane harvesting depends on the harvesting technique. 61% of the area is harvested manually, only requiring a cane loader is needed (diesel consumption CO: 10.73 kg/ha; diesel consumption ecoinvent crane loader: 0.106 kg/m3). The values, which are used for the processes, are extrapolated from the diesel use of the datasets..

Sugarcane stalks are cut into three-budded setts and "planted" in rows (diesel consumption: 5.8 kg/ha). The values used for the processes are extrapolated from the diesel use of the datasets (planting: 16.8 kg diesel per ha).

exchanges.description: Estimated value: The dominant sugar cane irrigation system in Colombia is the open gravity canal (82.5%) and on some plantations more efficient pipe irrigation systems are used (17.5%). The water emissions are calculated based on the irrigation efficiency of 50% for open gravity canals and 90% for drip irrigation. The water infiltrated is assussumed to reach the ground water (80%) and surface water (20%).

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: calculations according to chapter "Emissions of heavy metals to agricultural soil, surface water and ground water" in "01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf" - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation)

Heavy-metal content of compost approximated from "litter from broilers" with a dry matter content of 65% based on the report "01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf", Tab. A.2 - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent.

Heavy-metal content of farmyard manure and organic fertilizers (litter from hens) from the report "01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf", Tab. A.3 - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation <http://www.ecoinvent.org/documentation>)

Heavy-metal content of vinasse is approximated from "Cattle liquid manure" with a dry matter content of 30% based on the report "01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf", Tab. A.3 - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: calculated according to the "Phosphorous emissions trough water erosion to surface water" approach in the SQCB background report. Fraction of phosphorus loss which effectively reaches the surface water system is 0.2. The enrichment factor is 2 and phosphorous concentration in the soil is 1 kg P / t soil.

flow.name: Phosphorus
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description: Estimation: In order to prepare the land, deep pans are shattered, the compact soil is broken up and the planting tilth is prepared for a good rooting depth (diesel consumption: 69.9 kg /ha). After every harvest (total 6 cuttings), the harvest residues are mixed into the soil (diesel consumption: 5.6kg/ha). The values used for the processes are extrapolated from the diesel use of the datasets (Tillage, harrowing: 11.49 kg diesel per ha).

exchanges.description: Estimation: The diesel consumption for sugar cane harvesting depends on the harvesting technique. In Colombia 39% is harvested mechanically using a combine harvester (diesel consumption CO: 62.73 kg/ha; diesel consumption ecoinvent harvester: 166 kg/ha). The values, which are used for the processes, are extrapolated from the diesel use of the datasets.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of "sugarcane" is calculated to be circa 1.52E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: "ammonium sulfate, as N", "nitrogen fertiliser, as N", "phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5", "potassium chloride, as K2O", "urea, as N". The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.04E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

flow.name: packaging, for fertilisers

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sugarcane is calculated to be circa 5.45E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: "[sulfonyl]urea-compound", "atrazine", "glyphosate", "phenoxy-compound", "stone meal" (This substance can be used also as fertiliser but here it is accounted as pesticide only), "sulfur", "triazine-compound, unspecified", "zinc monosulfate", "zinc sulfide". The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.09E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
